definition: at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: But holding on to "what might have been" can actually be detrimental to your health.
sentences.chinese: 然而這種“悔不當初”的心境卻會有損健康。

sentences.english: If I'd known then what was going to happen， I wouldn't have done as I did.
Doing what's right today means no regrets tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 今日當做正確的事，莫待明日悔不當初。

definition: extreme benevolence, utmost duty (idiom); meticulous virtue and attention to duty
to make a terrible scene (idiom)/to throw a tantrum
pinyin: yi1 ku1 er4 nao4 san1 shang4 diao4

definition: the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
to have a high notion of one's duty/to be highly principled
spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to act rashly/to act precipitously regardless of the consequences/reckless/foolhardy/daredevil
